_candidate_description:
The story is always evolving.

I come from one of those big Brady Bunch families. Seriously, seven of us kids. All unique personalities, talents, beliefs on various subjects, and purposes. What an amazing foundation I was provided with. Thanks, Mom and Dad.

Initially, like many people, my journey was a winding road with roadblocks and detours. If I was inspired to try something I would often jump in with both feet.

Then, in 2003, a family member introduced me to an opportunity in Advertising as a Creative Recruiter. The culture of Agency Life blew me away. My first boss was a dream come true. She was such an amazing mentor. Like a sponge, I tried to absorb everything.

It’s been nearly 20 years since I first stepped foot into Advertising and I'm still soaking it in, learning something new, building relationships, and meeting talented people.

My next chapter is driven to focus on mentoring and helping to guide opportunities.

It's my give-back season.

An experienced this is demo copy for testing and enthusiastic digitally-focused individual who comes with a genuine interest and talent for technical production, and a strong background in digital asset preparation, quality assurance, and testing
•
This is someone who is detail-oriented, able to manage a large volume of work across multiple brands & channels as needed, and has expertise in best digital production practices
•
This is someone who zooms in to finesse the tiniest details, but also be able to step back and see the whole picture
•
A healthy design background and a great understanding of design, including typography, layout and composition, within an agency environment
•
Showcase a strong portfolio with technically-sound design mechanics and pixel-perfect digital work across a variety of channels

post_content:
Matt started his creative career by proudly selling his childhood drawings door to door. From there, he's only scaled up—working on global brands like Pizza Hut, Pepsi, T-Mobile, Converse and Hewlett Packard, as well as independent startups and local restaurants. As Creative Director, he’s led cross-channel teams, from print to digital, branding to social, and everything in-between. He loves being a trusted creative partner to help create strategically driven, emotionally- resonant creative that elevates brands in fun ways. As part of the creative duo, Magnificent Beard, he’s created globally recognized packaging, illustration and poster design for independent breweries and musical artists like Big Boi, the Wu-Tang Clan, M83, and the Walkmen.

He resides in Dallas with his wife Adrienne, and two dood puppers Riley & Oscar, and spends most of his free time plucking around on a guitar and arguing with his friends about music, food and pop culture.

post_content:
I like to wake up each day and give Mary Sunshine a high five. I’m an energetic, awarding-winning creative with 20+ years experience partnering with clients, leading integrated teams, and building brands. I’ve worked at large, nationally-recognized agencies; and I’ve helped architect boutique shops from the ground up. The common denominator? Clients want answers, not agencies.

I’ve had the opportunity to help brands like State Farm, Morgan Stanley, Budweiser, Chicago Bears, McDonald's, and numerous others solve business problems through creativity.

Being a creative leader has brought me so much joy. I've helped win agency-altering accounts. Built entire departments from scratch. And learned how to manage a P&L statement.

I've met a million talented and amazing individuals who have taught me so much. I'd love to share my knowledge, enthusiasm, and ideas with you.

_candidate_description:
I’m an expert team leader, adept at leading creatives, and familiar with working closely with art directors, writers, strategists, producers, and designers. With an ability to both understand and participate in strategic conversations and lead others through the creative conception, development, and execution process. And experience working at scale and leading complex work streams independently. I’m outstanding at crafting the detail from conception to delivery. Consistently able to connect the dots in multiculture to find common ground between a brand and its consumers.

My specialty is to help strategize against brand launches. My experiences are well-rounded and include a mix of many subject areas, from conception and driving outstanding creative and branding, video/photo shoots, and campaign development to strategy and narrative and developing digital journeys driven by consumer insight. With an ability to hardwire the layers of the funnel, so the creative of the upper funnel feels connected to what the consumer experiences in the mid-funnel. 

I can amplify the voice and graphic language that expresses the heart and soul of the brand, your partners, products, and services to inspire your consumers. And can lead and champion concepts and executions in partnership with internal and external creative teams and other marketing functions. I can  develop work focused on specific seasonal and calendar-specific launches as well as evergreen brand campaigns that go full end-to-end, including creative brand strategy, concepting, narrative, experiences, digital and social executions.

If you’re looking for thought leadership, vision, and a deep understanding of the creative landscape across the globe, I can help you find new spaces to grow.

For 5 minutes on his birth certificate, he was known as Alexandro. Then his mom realized the hospital had made a mistake. “It’s Alejandro with a J. Not an X” she said. So it was changed back. But he decided to keep the first one in his back pocket anyways.

Alejandro “Alexandro” Arellano is a seasoned senior creative with 20 years
of extensive concept development and brand positioning knowledge in both the General and Hispanic markets.

His hunger to break barriers in the ad industry have garnered him recognition in various festivals including Cannes Lions, Clio’s, HOW magazine and Lurzer’s Archive.

His passion to develop trust with clients has contributed to producing memorable campaigns in both traditional and social platforms.

post_content:
I am, have been, and will always be an artist. I’ve been fortunate
to work with inspiring people at great places throughout my
career. I am passionate about smart, strategic, creative ideas
that lead to cool, interesting, engaging executions. I don’t think
cool for cool’s sake or smart for smart’s sake works. To me, the
intersection of intelligent and intriguing is where compelling lies.
I believe that brands should curate the entire interaction
into one cohesive brand experience. I believe that when
brands talk to each other we all lose, because they’ve lost
sight of the end consumer and missed an opportunity
to tap into an emotional connection with the product.
Outside advertising, I’ve made logos for everything
from top-selling country artists and whiskey labels to
international science conferences and government
programs. I like to always be making things.
I’m a gamer, a skier, a chef and a goofball. I think you have to have
fun when you’re coming up with ideas and that fun translates
into the final product. And most importantly, I believe that
teamwork makes the dreamwork, and no one is above the work.

post_content: The highest compliment I've been given is that I know how to spin a good yarn. I've been telling stories my whole life, from doing professional theater when I was a kid to surprising the regulars at random open mics, today. Before advertising, I worked in the entertainment industry, doing jobs on both sides of the camera and in all facets of production. This gave me a bit of a head start when getting into advertising, but it hasn't made me lazy. I'm constantly studying the craft of storytelling, learning from my betters, and hopefully, improving. I'd love to tell you more about it in person, so you can judge for yourself the quality of my yarn.

post_content: Like a tone poem echoing through the eternal chasm of thoughtitude, Tony brings a shift in the transcendental tectons of integrated marketing communications. Known for cerebral gravy swells and thought-shearing perceptions, his writing constellates in a subliminal thinkspace that exists between the edge of infinity and nucleus of id. With an iron will and mildly professional garb, Tony triumphs at birthing novæ, chopping mountains and forging an earthen union between product and consumer. Unless the client is fearful of heart, then he just writes something clever.

post_content:
I'm a creator. A storyteller. An empathetic leader. All those cliche things that people say but it's true.

I'm powered by coffee and the fear of boredom.

I think advertising is the best industry out there. We get paid to be weird and be creative. We get to combine strategic smarts with creative wit. That said I do think there are problems in the industry. Leadership could be better, we can break some of the toxic playbook. We could actually teach people how to be leaders instead of throwing them in the fire to "just learn".

That's why I don't just help my teams create awesome stuff but I really foster my seniors, ACD and hey, even juniors, to be actual leaders.

post_content:
My background is in art direction and design. I am what you would call a collector. From a young age on, I would collect my “treasures” which turned into a passion for collecting various knowledge and skills that would fuel my creativity. I am the type of person that sees what she wants and goes for it while breaking down barriers that may get in my way.

I am always looking to further my knowledge and skills in order to continuously be up to date with current trends. While I am extremely detail oriented and organized, I am never afraid to color outside the lines and break the rules when necessary.

I enjoy creating and designing things, daydreaming, cats and learning new skills whenever I can (while still collecting). I am extremely in touch with the continually changing world around me and have been since I was a little girl. If something really catches my attention, I will jump in head first. I am very passionate about my work and love what I do.

_candidate_description:
Hello.

My name is Darren. I’m Chinese by birth, American by affiliation, Casual Geek by aesthetic, and a “good human being” by choice.

Yes, I love video games. Yes, I watch anime. And bad science fiction shows. Yes, I know how to build a computer and occasionally fix one.

No, I do not speak Chinese. No, I do not know Kung Fu. No, I do not in fact age. At all. True story.

I do however cook some really mean Chinese food.

By day, I’m a mild-mannered copywriter. By holidays, most weekends, and some nights, I’m a mild-mannered copywriter who occasionally takes breaks to become a survivor of the zombie apocalypse, a space marine, a slightly ham-handed magician, and (on the off occasion) a magical Keebler elf who makes muffins, cookies, french toast, and other goodies for people.

Please check out all the cool stuff I've worked on at http://www.darren-tang.com.

post_content:
Here's a list of services I offer on a freelance basis:

💫 Creative Leadership: From small teams to leading international units, I work with creatives on an 'intelligence first' approach— stripping traditional titles to form hybrid teams that empower creatives to contribute per natural strengths as much as acquired skills. From producer-creative hybrids to writer-director talent to strategists who aspire to become colourists, I pride myself at nurturing multi-potentialites and try to create a space where they feel comfortable bringing their whole selves.

🎬 Multi-Length Content Development: I work with brands and film directors to develop story driven content. This involves research, crafting characters, and ideating storylines across a variety of content such as documentaries, music videos, social shorts and episodics.

✍🏽 Writing + Art Direction: I work as a hybrid and can support either area, or combine the two to deliver as a one-stop-shop. From clear concepts to visceral narratives, I can help craft treatments, scripts, and concepts. Additionally, I work with directors as a ghost creative to design treatments, craft look & feel, write narratives, and assist with visual research for their films.

🦾 Generative Ai Toolkit: Over the past few months I’ve been working across a number of Ai platforms such as Midjourney, Stable Diffusion, Runway, and Chat GPT to name a few. It has allowed me to create playbooks and guides for brands and agencies on how to incorporate Ai within their creative work flow. While the landscape is constantly shifting, I’m able to support at a maker and/or creative researcher capacity.

🤔 Where could you plug me in?
Content Development | Branded Entertainment | Creative Strategy | Creative Consulting | Network Pitches | Director Treatments | Brand Campaigns | Creative Director | Art Director and/or Writer.

Please reach out if one or all fit what you’re looking for!

✌🏽

post_content: As an award-winning freelance Creative Director, Art Director, Video Director, Animator, Designer, and Artist, I specialize in social media, short-form video, and design for entertainment and media brands. Nineteen years of hands-on experience includes leading and collaborating upon a variety of creative projects ranging from video and animation to print and digital design. With a proclivity for unconventional, whimsically rebellious creative that boldly harnesses offbeat visuals, humor, and nostalgia, my aesthetic appeals to a youthful, contemporary audience. My client roster encompasses NBCUniversal, Paramount brands including Comedy Central and MTV, the New York Post, Entertainment Weekly, the Upright Citizens Brigade, Edelman, Movement Strategy, AKA, VidMob, and many other brands and agencies. Work samples are available at www.elizabethstarkey.com. I'm currently in the process of establishing a solid foundation for Blazing Fig, a playfully disruptive creative studio that helps clients stay relevant, fresh, and unique in a crowded media landscape while creating opportunities to engage with and charm fans and followers through unexpected techniques like stop motion, experimental live-action, and practical effects. While initially focusing on strategically subversive short-form social content, the studio's offerings will expand to include music videos, bumpers, commercials, and more.

post_content:
Who comes to mind when you think of a person who constantly complains about working in advertising, someone who whines about the side-projects focused, the one who resorts to PlanB and dreams about what to do when this business is over? Do you know that person?

Well, not me. I’m Pablo Vilar, my nickname is Pequeño and, ironically, I'm craving for good and BIG advertising ideas.

For almost a decade now, I’ve come up with this creative work. I’m soooo into football. I really enjoy football briefs. And I love edgy campaigns. I feel at ease when I talk to lawyers. I am guilty of challenging my favourite Brand concern ¨I don’t know whether we can do this¨, because finding solutions to obstacles is my strong suit.

(Spoiler: We SHOULD do this!)

So, I’ve become a quick, simple, funny, and powerful campaigns junkie. Campaigns that make me love this job - still.

And, to be honest, I have so many more ideas up my sleeve.

post_content:
I am a copywriter, storyteller, creative thinker, and problem solver. When I first stepped into an advertising agency as a copy intern, I had no clue I was just about to find MY PLACE. The truth is, I stumbled into advertising riding high on a rebellion instigated by tragic personal loss. There I was, in righteous indignation, angry with the world at large, when I decided to do a complete 180 on my life. The first thing I did, was dye my hair red (obviously!), and the next thing I did was even worse, I went back to college! Anticlimactic, but that is the kind of person I am. Books have always been my refuge. So this time, when I turned to words again, I earned two gold medals at the university and found my place at one of the most prestigious creative agencies in the world.

As a creative, I've learned that advertising is a business of ideas. Not words, not lines, but thoughts-ideas. And these ideas help sell more than products. They help inspire change and share cultures, beliefs, traditions, and feelings. As copywriters, we think of great big ideas that touch the simplest and most ordinary of human lives and, most importantly, tell stories.

Over the years, as a professional writer, in advertising, I have had the opportunity to tell a lot of product stories, which are essentially stories of human behavior - their generosity, kindness, humor, and love for various platforms like digital, television, print, experiential and, have explored different forms, and styles of writing and storytelling.

I love everything about advertising - thinking of ideas, finding real insights, and executing them so that they survive for posterity. It is not a 9 to 5 deal, and therein lies the beauty of it. Every moment of every day can be the time when the idea strikes. That's the magic of it, and I love the unpredictability this profession offers. The adventure it provides every single day.

That is what I am looking for, to write impactful copy where every line-every word has a thought, an idea ascribed to it.

post_content: At my core, I am a Global Creative Director, a Mentor and a UI/UX/CX Hybrid Designer Director and Lead Designer. I come alive when I'm charged with finding the right concept that tells the right story and uses the right channel strategy for maximum business and brand impact.  But in the last 10+ years of my career, I'm most proud of being a mentor to growing talented designers across breadth of disciplines, like copy, graphic, motion, digital, video, editing, etc. I'm looking to work with a team of thinkers and doers - to refine, reshape and nudge creativity across a variety of formats.

Wisdom: http://youtu.be/MHXUl1xbXss
Proud to be a misfit: http://youtu.be/P9fTld5_XPw

[Esports & Gaming Bio]
Brian Jung is/was a former pro gamer having competed in Call of Duty and America's Army in the early 2000s. He competed in the first ever US mobile MOBA game, Vainglory. He's also competed briefly in games like Call of Duty Mobile, and PUBG Mobile. He was invited to the Twitch Partner program in 2015 as a specialist in mobile esports, and has been streaming and making content ever since on his channel www.twitch.tv/autokorrect

He was the Vice President Creative & Brand at the esport org, Immortals, where he managed the creative and brand marketing across all esport teams. Working closely with Blizzard and the newly created Overwatch League, he helped launch the new LA Valiant Overwatch pro team into the inaugural season of the OWL. In combination with nearly 15 years of traditional creative ad agency experience at global ad agencies like TBWA, DDB, and Publicis, he has used his gaming/esports expertise to help advise non-endemic brands and agencies on how to market within this category as well as work with game publishers/developers like Riot Games (Valorant) to concept ideas on how to market their game more creatively. In 2019 he managed Temecula FC in the first ever FIFA Pro Clubs eNPSL league that saw several physical NPSL soccer clubs compete in the FIFA 11v11 Pro Clubs mode. He currently competes in the highest level of North American EA Sports FIFA23 Pro Clubs 11v11 esport leagues with team FGF Esports.

Most evenings you'll find Brian streaming on Twitch through his online persona, "AutoKorrect", where he plays DayZ, Escape from Tarkov, FIFA, Warzone DMZ, and various mobile games.

I’ve spent my career leading creative development in large agencies in Chicago, Baltimore and Philadelphia, helping powerhouse brands (like McDonald’s, Hyundai, Anheuser Busch, Marriott Hotels, Taco Bell, Wrigley’s Gum, MillerCoors and Coca Cola) move the needle conceptually
and financially.  Above all, my creative vision is my greatest asset. I lead my cross-functional teams with passion and a relentless commitment to core, big ideas that capture the imagination. I believe it’s all about creating meaningful and memorable connections between the brand and the consumer. I’m known for fostering progressive thinking and pushing design boundaries, applying artistry and craftsmanship to strategic insight to bring to life concepts that move brands forward.

post_content:
I am a creative visionary with a deep passion for art direction and a strong focus on delivering exceptional brand experiences. With a diverse skill set encompassing digital and print design, illustration, and fine art, I bring a unique blend of creativity and leadership to every project I undertake.

Throughout my career, I have had the privilege of working with renowned clients and leading creative teams to conceptualize and execute innovative campaigns. My goal is to push the boundaries of creativity, constantly seeking new ways to captivate audiences and connect them with brands on a deeper level.

As an Associate Creative Director, I thrive in collaborative environments where I can inspire and motivate teams to reach their full potential. I believe that great ideas come from nurturing a culture of creativity, where every team member feels empowered to contribute their unique perspectives.

I am known for my ability to translate business goals into compelling visual experiences, always keeping the customer at the center of my creative process. Whether it's developing brand storytelling through a shopper and digital lens or creating captivating visuals for integrated commerce campaigns, I strive to create meaningful connections between brands and their target audiences.

In addition to my professional experience, I am a lifelong learner and stay up-to-date with the latest design trends and technologies. This allows me to bring fresh and innovative ideas to the table, ensuring that my work remains at the forefront of the industry.

Outside of my professional endeavors, I am an avid supporter of the arts and actively involved in my local creative community. I believe that creativity has the power to inspire change and enrich our lives, and I am dedicated to making a positive impact through my work.

If you are seeking a dynamic and visionary creative/art director who can lead teams to deliver exceptional results, I would love to connect and explore how we can bring your brand's vision to life. Let's collaborate and create something extraordinary together.

post_content:
Howdy!

I'm Kasey, and I'm absolutely thrilled to be a part of the dynamic world of advertising. To me, working in this industry is more than just a job; it's my true passion and source of endless excitement.

I have a particular soft spot for experiential work, where I can create immersive and unforgettable brand experiences. The ability to engage all the senses and craft moments that resonate deeply with audiences is something I find incredibly rewarding. That being said, I genuinely enjoy all types of work in the industry, as each brings its own unique set of challenges and opportunities for creativity.

One thing you should know about me is that I have an insatiable thirst for learning. I firmly believe that growth and innovation come from constantly expanding our knowledge and challenging ourselves. As part of my commitment to continuous learning, I recently had the incredible honor of being selected as one of the 30 individuals globally to participate in the prestigious Cannes Lions School of Creativity. It was a transformative experience that further fueled my passion and broadened my creative horizons.

When it comes to my approach to work, I bring a mix of kindness, a can-do attitude, and a touch of goofiness. I believe in fostering collaborative and positive relationships, both within the team and with clients, as it brings out the best in everyone. I'm not afraid to throw totally oddball ideas at the wall, experimenting fearlessly to uncover innovative solutions and push the boundaries of what's possible.

With kindness, a can-do attitude, and a touch of goofiness, I'm eager to collaborate on projects that captivate audiences and make a lasting impact. Thank you for taking the time to get to know me. I'm excited to connect and embark on creative adventures together!

Warm regards,

Kasey

post_content:
2.7 billion years ago, lava poured out of cracks in the primordial ocean floor. The remains of this glowing, volcanic rock formed the Canadian Shield in northeast Minnesota. Out of these mountains sprang the Iron Range. And then I was born in the suburbs of Minneapolis.

My heart was built from my home, and my home is the state of beasts, the state of beards and the palace of warriors. I ride a blazing chariot of fire through the wilderness carving my name into the earth in search of truth and beauty and pizza.

post_content:
As an award-winning 20+ year veteran in the digital and advertising space, I am no stranger to collaboration, having worked with a wide range of clients in diverse industries such as retail, banking, healthcare, and tech, managing a portfolio of B2B and B2C accounts. Throughout my career, I have had the privilege of working on projects for 10 out of the 25 most valued companies in the world. As a team leader, I value the power of collaboration and leverage my strong communication skills to foster effective teamwork and seamless coordination among team members.

My passion for graphic design and technology is evident in my hands-on approach as a creator. I thrive on innovation, constantly seeking new ways to push the boundaries of digital media, including animations and HTML5 displays. Embracing modern digital best practices, I apply my expertise to deliver impactful experiences across various platforms and channels, ensuring brands stay relevant in the fast-paced digital landscape.

Beyond being a brand builder, I am a visionary who thrives on creativity. My commitment to creative design allows me to craft visually compelling assets that not only captivate audiences but also effectively communicate brand messages. Social media is a powerful tool that I wield with expertise, using it strategically to enhance brand visibility and engagement throughout the brand lifecycle.

But my impact doesn't stop there—I am also a mentor and a collaborative partner. I take pride in leading a high-performing team, guiding and nurturing them to excel in their roles. Through mentoring, I empower team members to unlock their full potential, helping them develop their skills and grow both personally and professionally.

My dedication to delivering award-winning projects with measurable results stems from my understanding of the digital landscape. By combining my expertise in both design and development technologies, I create comprehensive and effective growth marketing strategies that drive tangible outcomes for clients. With an unwavering focus on innovation and a keen eye for creative design, I continuously strive to leave a lasting impact on the brands I work with.

I’m Zak – an award-winning Creative Director working at the intersection of Music and Advertising.

I bring 13 years of experience, top agency credentials, and an entrepreneurial spirit to the table. I've worked at R/GA, Code & Theory, McGarryBowen, and more in New York, San Francisco, and Detroit. And most recently, I co-ran Shion Studio, a small agency, by generating new business, presenting to C-level clients, and overseeing the creative department, resulting in wins at the Webbys, Clios, Awwwards, and more.

On the side, I'm a musician who started Kaz Audio – an award-winning music house that makes and licenses music for Nike, Apple, Heineken, Pepsi, Merrell, and more.

Interested in talking? Let's definitely set something up.

post_content:
I'm Sofia Cristina, an aspiring art director, and versatile freelance designer. I hold a BA in Advertising with a minor in studio arts from Valparaiso University, where I gained a solid foundation in the field. Additionally, I honed my skill set further at the esteemed Chicago Portfolio School, where I immersed myself in the art of design.

With a deep passion for visual aesthetics and a keen eye for design, I'm ready to advance as an Art Director. I bring a wealth of experience in delivering exceptional creative solutions and crafting engaging visual campaigns. I blend advertising expertise with artistic sensibilities to create compelling visual narratives that resonate across mediums. Collaboration is key to my process, and I thrive in dynamic team environments where ideas flow freely. Committed to excellence, I continuously seek growth and push the boundaries of creativity. Let's elevate brands and create impactful visual experiences together as I embark on my next chapter as an Art Director.

post_content:
Hilary Smith is an award-winning freelance writer / creative director / creative consultant / branding specialist with 13 years of experience working across fashion, beauty, entertainment, tech, food / bev, sports, health / wellness, insurance, finance, hospitality, and the nonprofit sector.

Collaborating with a range of entities - ad agencies, production companies, brands & artists alike - Hilary writes, guides and makes ideas & campaigns that are touching, and yet often shocking too.

In a time when we’re bombarded by “content,” her speciality is delivering a strong dose of wit and attitude, designed to stand out. Hilary is on a mission to push the envelope; to draw a line in the sand; to say what’s not been said.

Obsessive about aesthetics & art direction, style is at the heart of everything she creates.

Hilary is also a creative strategy expert, mining human insights and the cultural lexicon to craft verbal identities, positionings, brand voices & brand books for global clients including HP and the legendary French fashion house, Longchamp.

Beyond this, Hilary is an actor and film director.

Her work has been internationally recognized by the likes of D&AD, Clio Awards, Vimeo Staff Pick, Ad Age Editor’s Pick and more.

post_content:
I'm an adventurous soul with a passion for the written word and a love of human truths. My key value is applying my unique POV to my work.

My experiences range from wildland firefighting in the boonies of Oregon to working within the fashion industry of Barcelona. I've also written words with Allen Hall Advertising, BRINK Interactive, and SKVOT (a collaborative project with AD students in Ukraine). Currently writing words and throwing out ideas at Hijinx Portland.

Outside of work, I spend summers chasing waves and winters chasing powder. And while landlocked in the city, I get my fix by clocking miles on running trails.

post_content:
I got into this business because I love challenges; each brief was a new challenge to be solved. In my early days, it was fairly straightforward: write pages of headlines or scripts and think of interesting ways to present ideas in visually compelling ways.

As the industry has evolved, I’ve found new challenges that are equally rewarding. I have worked on, and managed teams for, clients in a variety of industries. I co-led one small creative department which my partner and I built into a fully integrated department – the first for that agency. I worked on one of the largest brands in the world, helping them shift from mostly traditional media to overwhelmingly digital.

I’ve also developed a real appreciation for strategy and brand-building, and I found that I have a good head for it. This includes crafting and defining brand strategy and making the work that comes out of it. It’s my belief that the more our industry relies on tech, the more important it is that we remain sharply focused on brand strategy and representing a brand’s voice.

I'm a results-driven Creative Director with a proven track record of elevating brand presence and driving impactful marketing campaigns. With over 20 years of experience leading cross-functional teams and collaborating with diverse stakeholders, I bring a unique blend of strategic thinking, innovative ideas, and project management expertise to deliver exceptional creative solutions.

Throughout my career, I have spearheaded successful initiatives for renowned brands such as UPS, ESPN, Capital One, BFGoodrich, Ping, Coors Light, Discover Card, Walmart and many others, achieving remarkable results in brand awareness, impressions, and cost savings. I have a passion for pushing boundaries and creating engaging content across multiple platforms, including digital, social media, TV, print, animation, and video.

As a hands-on leader, I have fostered a collaborative and inclusive work environment, driving continuous improvement and empowering team members to achieve their full potential. I thrive on inspiring creativity and delivering exceptional results that align with business objectives.

If you are seeking a visionary Creative Director with a passion for innovation and a track record of driving brand success, let's connect. Together, we can create compelling experiences that captivate audiences and elevate brands to new heights.

_candidate_description:
I'm a proven Copywriter and Creative Director with over 30 years of experience acquired at, surprisingly, only three advertising agencies, all in New York City. If you think that says something impressive about loyalty, reliability, and the value of my work, you’re probably right.

From my start as the most junior of copywriters to my most recent roles as creative lead, I've been responsible for driving, inspiring and leading both myself and my teams to purpose-driven ideas and delivering increasingly more integrated solutions, across every consumer touchpoint imaginable, and resulting in unforgettable brand experiences.

I have a track record of leveraging creativity to create compelling content in both traditional and new media, helping brands grow, flourish and win, and I understand that creative excellence based on keen strategic insight is the most effective way to move audiences.

Prior to a life in advertising, I attended Cornell University where I earned, without irony, a B.S. in Communication.

A few random bits – I've gut-renovated two Manhattan apartments but swear to never do a third, I've trekked solo by motorcycle from East Coast to West and from Canada to Mexico, I endeavor to keep growing and learning and all-around bettering myself and the world around me, and soon, I swear, I will learn to play guitar.

Currently, I live in NYC with my dog Lex, a very remarkable Boxer.

post_content:
Phil Neves is a Brazilian-American Creative Director currently working at Group Black, an inclusive, mission-driven media company focused on dramatically transforming the face of media ownership and investment. Phil was hired at Group Black to lead the company's creative vision and launch the brand. Brand awareness has been built through strategic creative executions in the media and advertising industry via experiential activations at leading industry events such as Cannes Lions, ADCOLOR, SXSW, and CES.

Prior to Group Black, he was the Creative Director at Holler, a next-gen tech company in the messaging space. Phil was originally brought on at Holler as the company's first ever creative hire, where he built out the creative studio (a team of animators, illustrators and content strategists that ideate and produce content for messaging). After building the team, he transitioned into a Creative Director role that oversaw Holler's rebrand and became responsible for all creative aspects relating to Holler's marketing and branding.

Phil has also worked as the Senior Art Director at Inspira Marketing, an independent agency and leader in the experiential marketing space. At Inspira, Phil helped build immersive experiences for brands such as Diageo, Guinness, Geico, and Virgin Atlantic.

In his free time, Phil takes on personal projects to help small companies and creators build their brand identity and digital presence. He has a BA from the University of Miami in both Studio Art and Filmmaking with a minor in Marketing. Phil is fluent in English, Portuguese, German, and Spanish.

post_content: From sloppywriter to copywriter Some creatives are born knowing their lives are destined for advertising. I’m not one of them. But I did have enough sense as an undergrad to realize I’m a writer. After graduating with my creative writing degree, I sold everything I owned except for a few boxes of books and some clothes and moved to Seoul, South Korea. Like most expats who move to Korea “for a year or two to explore the world while I figure my life out”, I fell in love with the culture and stayed for several more. I taught English, became a kimchi connoisseur, haphazardly kept a journal, made friends from every continent except Antarctica, wrote a novel, learned to awkwardly fumble my way through basic Korean conversation, organized a weekly writing workshop, explored the region, and became addicted to psychology books and board game cafes. What does any of this have to do with advertising? In my opinion, everything. Faced with the same existential dilemma as pretty much every expat who moves abroad to teach English with a humanities degree—this is a blast, but what’s next?—I eventually found advertising. Researching a typical day in the life of a copywriter, it seemed I’d finally discovered my field. After all, how many occupations offer that perfect cocktail of armchair psychology, writing and storytelling, art, conceptual and strategic thinking, salesmanship, creative collaboration, empathy, neverending cultural curiosity, and breadth of mediums? Eager to confirm my suspicion, I cold emailed a few agencies as soon as I got back to Dallas to ask if I might shadow. Two and a half years later, I was on the bus in Seattle when I heard one of my broadcast radio spots for the first time. My script was speaking to public bus drivers, inviting them to “Drop off stressful working conditions and pick up better compensation by applying today”—that is, for a laidback, high-paying corporate shuttle route. I smiled at the synchronicity of the moment, imagining that somewhere on the road, or perhaps just a couple seats in front of me, was a bus driver who’d just been wondering, as we all do at times, What’s next?

post_content: I’m Ali — I eat words for breakfast and develop social personas in my sleep. In other words, I’m an optimistic, detail-oriented copywriter with 5+ years of experience in the social media and digital marketing field. I specialize in all things entertainment and lifestyle, and love to weave captivating brand narratives that clients — and the legal team — love. Aside from amazing alliteration, my strengths lie in voice and tone development, creative ideation, and social strategy. I love to find inspiration in the mundane, and I can make puns appear out of thin air. Oh, and I'm also an Oxford comma enthusiast.

post_content:
I grew up in a family of seven girls, no boys. Yep. That's some serious character building. The experience of growing up in my close knit family taught me the skills that I continue to use every day in my business — how to pivot when your situation changes, how to think creatively to get your point across, how to bring people together, how to learn from your mistakes, how to always lead by example, how to make sure that someone feels valued and, most importantly, how to be a really good listener.

In my 20 years of art direction, design and leadership experience, I have worked in the worlds of consumer marketing, shopper marketing and direct response. I love that my work experience is this broad. It has helped me to be prepared for literally anything that is thrown at me.

I have worked with large Chicago-based Marketing agencies on Fortune 500 brands, with small entrepreneurs and also with non-profits. From a nationally recognized brand to one person with a really interesting idea, I feel fortunate to have had exposure to such a variety of clients. I am able to jump right into the creative flow with current creative teams and have also led my own independent concepts and designs from initial brief to final production. I am comfortable and equipped to work offsite or onsite with an existing creative team.

No matter the creative challenge, I continue to push myself to look at each project with innovative ideas and a fresh approach to the design in order to arrive at the visual solution that feels right and works in the marketplace.

I welcome the opportunity to work together soon.
